description:
Now Lloyd Everitt is a young British actor who recently played one of Shakespeare's greatest roles, Othello. Unlike the other members of the cast, Lloyd found it a real challenge to learn his lines. He has dyslexia, which makes reading and remembering words a struggle. But Lloyd came up with an unusual solution to the problem. He came into the Outlook studio to tell me more.

You read something, and then you look back at the page and you lose your place completely and then you don't even know what you've read. So, too confusing. I really did struggle with that.

And I believe that you had to come up with a system of giving yourself visual clues to make sure you could learn the lines properly.

Yeah. How I learn my lines, usually, is when I say the word, I picture what it is in my head. I was just like most actors with dyslexia, really drilling in, spending hours and hours and hours and hours upon it. But I had an audition where I had 12 pages to learn from. And it was only two or three days and I knew that was never gonna happen. But then I just started to actually put the pictures onto a page and then not even look at the lines, just look at the pictures.
